clean_content:
Definition / general

* Normal neural structure associated with taste buds

Essential features

* Generally asymptomatic but may present as white or red patches, hyperplastic nodules, ulcers or complaints of a burning sensation

Terminology

* Also called the subepithelial nerve plexus of taste buds

Sites

* Posterior third of the lateral tongue

Case reports

* 69 year old woman with small indurated lesion on the lateral border of tongue ([Case of the Week #445](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445.htm))

Microscopic (histologic) description

Shows a biphasic pattern:

* **Superficial part** of the lesion
  + Contains elongated and wavy spindle cells running in parallel to the epithelium+ Can contain varying amounts of collagen+ May have an inflammatory infiltrate and lymphoid follicles* **Deeper part** of the lesion
    + Contains small nerve fascicles and scattered ganglion cells

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Vasiliki Tzelepi, M.D.  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image1x5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image1x5.jpg)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image2x20.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image2x20.jpg)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image3x20.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image3x20.jpg)

Lateral border of tongue

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image9HEX40_tastebuds.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image9HEX40_tastebuds.jpg)

Taste buds

  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image4S100x5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image4S100x5.jpg)

S100

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image5EMAx5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image5EMAx5.jpg)

EMA

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image6CK8_18x5.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image6CK8_18x5.jpg)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image7CK8_18x20.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case445image7CK8_18x20.jpg)

CK8 / 18

Positive stains

* Superficial part: [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [NSE](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsNSE.html), [CD56](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd56.html) (fibrillar pattern)* Lower part: [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html), [EMA](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsema.html), [NSE](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsNSE.html), [CD56](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd56.html) (fibrillar pattern)* Taste buds in the overlying epithelium: [CK8](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck8.html), [CK18](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck18.html)

Differential diagnosis

* **Neural neoplasms** such as [neurofibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueneurofibroma.html) or [neuroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissueneuroma.html)* Invasive [squamous cell carcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityscc.html), when squamous islands present
